lead_paragraph: BERNARD--Herbert C.,Congregation Emanu-EI of the City of New York records with an admixture of sorrow and gratitude the passing of Herbert C. Bernard in his 104th year: sorrow that his unique presence is no longer ours to experience, and gratitude for the extraordinary length of his years. His devotion to our Congregation was made manifest in many ways over multiple decades. His active presence on our Board of Trustees for more than fifty years was almost without precedent, and his service as Secretary to the Congregation was the longest in the Temple's history. Mr. Bernard's generosity of spirit was treasured while he lived and never to be forgotten will be his gift and that of his late beloved wife in making possible the creation of the Herbert and Eileen Bernard Museum of Judaica at Temple Emanu-EI. To his cherished children, Migs and Lewis, and their families, we extend our heartfelt understanding. May his memory forever be a blessing. The Family of Temple Emanu-EI 1/3
